channel.title: Client, with errors
channel.description:
Is it possible that a single "(" could cause 100 errors? The majority of the errors I am getting are Illegal start of expression, which makes me think it could be.
I've recently extracted a client and then decompiled the client.class, when compiling it gives me 100 errors, now my first thought would be it would be a bracket? So I checked the number of brackets and they add up fine, I checked the number of parentheses and there is ONE extra "(" than ")".
Could this be the problem?
If not, then why am I getting 100 errors when compiling, the file hasn't been modified in any way and it's come straight from the client.

item.title: Client, with errors
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

Is it possible that a single “(” could cause 100 errors? The majority of the errors I am getting are Illegal start of expression, which makes me think it could be.

I’ve recently extracted a client and then decompiled the client.class, when compiling it gives me 100 errors, now my first thought would be it would be a bracket? So I checked the number of brackets and they add up fine, I checked the number of parentheses and there is ONE extra “(” than “)”.

Could this be the problem?

If not, then why am I getting 100 errors when compiling, the file hasn’t been modified in any way and it’s come straight from the client.

Read full topic
